question: At 604L/184P scale, how much of the swarm knowledge graph is structurally unreachable?
method: 5-dimensional grep-based reachability scan across lessons, principles, tools, domains, and files
expect: 10-20% orphan rate across knowledge elements; domains with zero external refs exist

lessons.note: compact-lesson-cache.json indexes all lessons mechanically; semantic orphan rate is 0.16%. Citation network is remarkably dense.

principles.note: Every principle is referenced outside PRINCIPLES.md. Cross-referencing practices effective.

tools.note: All 23 are F-frontier tools and their tests from S186-era that should have been archived in S363 consolidation but were missed.

domains.frontier_id_collision: cryptocurrency F-CC1/2/3 collides with claude-code F-CC1/2/3/4
domains.note: 6 domains (13.6%) are structurally isolated from main navigation. 5 domains have open frontiers with zero experiments.

actual: Knowledge graph orphan rate is near-zero (0.16% lessons, 0% principles). Infrastructure orphan rate is 23% (tools not archived). Domain disconnection rate is 14%. Prediction of 10-20% was WRONG for knowledge, CORRECT for infrastructure.
diff: Expected uniform orphan rate; found split: knowledge dense (0%), infra dead (23%), domains patchy (14%). The swarm's citation practices are effective; the gap is in tool lifecycle and domain navigation.
root_causes: S363 tool consolidation archived 25 tools but missed 14 F-tools and 9 test files
Domain creation is easy but navigation wiring is manual â€” no enforcement mechanism
Frontier ID namespace is global but assigned per-domain without collision check

remediation.tools: Archive 23 orphan F-tools and tests to tools/archive/
remediation.domains: Add disconnected domains to top-level FRONTIER.md; fix F-CC collision
remediation.knowledge: L-649 needs one external citation to connect it
